decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressively attacking your opponent with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while also utilizing burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for your attackers. In addition, cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional value and versatility. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Thraben Charm and Static Prison to control the board. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent quickly and efficiently.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Control - UrzaTron deck revolves around assembling Urza's Tower, Mine, and Power Plant to generate large amounts of colorless mana quickly. This enables the deck to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny, as well as devastating spells like All Is Dust. The deck aims to control the board using cards like Ugin, the Eye of the Storms and Karn, the Great Creator, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Kozilek's Command and Vexing Bauble. The end goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats and overpowering control.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and utilizing various artifacts to disrupt opponents and generate card advantage. By combining efficient creatures with powerful artifacts like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive game plan. The deck also incorporates cards like Metallic Rebuke and Engineered Explosives to control the board and protect its key threats. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Tormod's Crypt and Shadowspear to interact with the graveyard and handle problematic opposing threats.

The primary focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse, in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. The deck also includes control elements like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to deal with opponent's threats, while using cards like Devourer of Destiny and Kozilek's Command to maintain board presence. The inclusion of cards like World Breaker and Writhing Chrysalis provides additional versatility and answers to different situations. Overall, the deck aims for a strong late-game presence through powerful Eldrazi threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy cheap artifacts and creatures onto the battlefield in order to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp, as well as cards like Memnite and Kappa Cannoneer to quickly build a board presence, this deck aims to apply pressure early and keep the opponent on the back foot. The inclusion of cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke also helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect the deck's own threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. By manipulating the graveyard and using instant spells, the deck aims to create explosive combos and overwhelm the opponent with threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect its game plan. Overall, the strategy revolves around instant reanimation and efficient use of graveyard resources to win the game.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, then using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a surprise attack. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and control the opponent's plays. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to manipulate the board and protect the combo. Overall, the deck aims to win quickly and decisively by reanimating creatures at instant speed.

The deck focuses on a powerful combo utilizing Jeskai Ascendancy and a variety of artifacts like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble. By continuously looping spells and triggers, the deck aims to generate large amounts of mana and card advantage while also potentially buffing up creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. The deck also includes interaction through cards like Metallic Rebuke and Portable Hole to disrupt opponents. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to create a powerful engine that can overwhelm opponents with tempo and value.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Solitude and Overlord of the Balemurk. Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Ephemerate provide recurring value, and Fatal Push handles threats efficiently. The mana base is optimized to support a variety of spells and creatures, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and controlling the board. This deck aims to control the game early on, disrupting the opponent's strategy while establishing a strong board presence to finish the game quickly.

The deck aims to control the game by using powerful Eldrazi creatures and Ugin planeswalkers alongside the UrzaTron lands to generate mana quickly. It focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like All Is Dust, Chalice of the Void, and Thought-Knot Seer while using Karn, the Great Creator to search for key artifacts. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Command to handle threats, and utilizes cards like Ugin's Labyrinth and Vexing Bauble to further disrupt the opponent's plans and gain an advantage in the late game.

The main concept of this deck is to use Allosaurus Rider along with Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to quickly tutor for and cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Xenagos, God of Revels, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes a variety of support cards like Pact of Negation, Veil of Summer, and Endurance to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's strategies. With the ability to generate massive amounts of mana and swarm the board with huge creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm and outpace the opponent for a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using artifacts efficiently to overwhelm opponents with a quick and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, players can quickly build a strong board presence with creatures like Ornithopter and Memnite. The deck also includes spells like Thoughtcast and Thought Monitor to draw more cards and maintain momentum. Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke provide control elements to deal with threatening cards from opponents. With a mix of mana acceleration and powerful creatures, this deck aims to quickly outpace opponents and secure victory.

This combo deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to cast powerful creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. The deck utilizes cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to tutor for key pieces and generate value. Planar Genesis helps maximize mana production, while Veil of Summer protects against disruption. The goal is to assemble the Allosaurus Combo as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence and win the game. Cards like Pact of Negation and Generous Ent provide additional support for the combo strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly playing and using artifacts to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal, Springleaf Drum, and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to build a board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke. The inclusion of efficient creatures like Memnite and Pinnacle Emissary allows for quick damage output, while cards like Thoughtcast and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage to keep the pressure on the opponent. The deck has a strong synergy between its artifacts and spells to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron - Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine - to generate significant mana advantage. It employs control elements like Karn, the Great Creator, Thought-Knot Seer, and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to disrupt opponents and control the game. The deck also includes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Devourer of Destiny and Sire of Seven Deaths to quickly close out the game once it has established control. Additionally, it runs cards like All Is Dust and Chalice of the Void for board control and disruption.

This deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells to control the game and pressure the opponent. By utilizing cards like Ephemerate and Consign to Memory, it can protect its threats while also removing opposing threats. It aims to quickly deploy creatures like Phelia and Ragavan to apply pressure, while also using Phage and Quantum Riddler for additional damage. The deck also includes versatile removal spells and disruption like Prismatic Ending and Spell Snare to stay ahead in the game. Its mana base is designed for consistency and flexibility, allowing for smooth gameplay and strong board presence.
